title: Bye-Bye to a Super Wood Carver!
content:
Hello, Super Star Listeners!

Hey there, super star friends! Your friendly African news reporter is here with a special story from our amazing continent, Africa! Today, we’re going to talk about a very special man from Nigeria. His name was Kasali Akangbe Ogun. Can you say that with me? Kasali Akangbe Ogun! He was like a magic maker, but instead of spells, he used wood! Sadly, Kasali Akangbe Ogun has gone to be with the stars, and everyone in his town is remembering him and all the wonderful things he did. It’s a bit sad, but it’s also a time to remember his amazing life and all the beautiful art he made for us to enjoy forever. He was a true master, and we are going to learn all about him and his super cool job today!

Who Was Kasali Akangbe Ogun?

Imagine someone who could look at a plain piece of wood and see a beautiful animal, a person, or a special shape hiding inside! That was Kasali Akangbe Ogun. He was a fantastic wood carver. What does a wood carver do? Well, they use special tools to cut, shape, and smooth wood into wonderful works of art! It’s like magic, turning something simple into something amazing. Kasali Akangbe Ogun spent his whole life doing this. He didn’t just make pretty things; he made things that told stories, things that helped people remember their history, and things that kept old traditions alive. He was a very important person in his community because he knew so much about wood and art. Did you know? Wood carving is one of the oldest arts in the world! People have been carving wood for thousands of years, even before there were cars or electricity!

What is Wood Carving?

Let's talk a little more about wood carving! Imagine you have a big block of wood. A wood carver uses sharp tools, like chisels and mallets, to carefully chip away pieces of the wood. They have to be very gentle and very strong at the same time. They carve animals like elephants, lions, and birds. They make statues of people, masks for celebrations, and even beautiful furniture for homes. Each piece of wood is different, just like each of us is unique! Some wood is hard, and some is soft. A good carver knows exactly how to work with each type of wood. It takes a lot of practice and a lot of patience to become as good as Kasali Akangbe Ogun was. He knew how to make the wood dance under his tools!

A Family of Carvers!

Guess what? Kasali Akangbe Ogun didn’t just wake up one day and become a master carver! This special skill ran in his family, like a special recipe passed down from generation to generation. His father was a wood carver, and his grandfather was a wood carver, and probably his great-grandfather too! It was a very old and special family tradition. Can you imagine learning your ABCs or how to count from your dad and grandad? That’s how Kasali learned to carve. He watched them, helped them, and then he started to carve his own beautiful pieces. When a skill is passed down like this, it makes it extra special and full of history. It means that the old ways of doing things, the old stories, and the old designs are kept safe and sound for new generations to enjoy. Did you know? In many parts of Africa, skills like carving, weaving, and drumming are taught from parents to children, keeping ancient arts alive!

Keeping Our Traditions Alive

One of the most important things Kasali Akangbe Ogun wanted to do was to keep local traditions safe. What are traditions? Traditions are special ways of doing things that a group of people have done for a very long time. It could be a special dance, a special song, a special story, or making special art like wood carvings. These traditions are like treasures because they tell us about who we are, where we come from, and what is important to our community. Kasali knew that if no one carved the old designs or told the old stories with his carvings, those traditions might get lost. He worked very hard to make sure that didn't happen. His carvings were like books, telling stories without words, showing us the beauty of his people's history and beliefs. He was a guardian of his culture!

Saying Goodbye to a Master

Sadly, Kasali Akangbe Ogun became a little bit sick, and then he passed away. Everyone was very sad because they loved him and his beautiful art so much. His community in Nigeria came together to say goodbye to him. It was a time for remembering all the wonderful things he created and all the smiles he brought to people’s faces. When someone special like Kasali leaves us, we don't just feel sad; we also feel thankful for everything they gave us. His burial was a time to celebrate his long and creative life, a life full of wood chips, smooth finishes, and amazing stories carved into every piece. People remembered his kindness, his wisdom, and his steady hands that could turn simple wood into stunning art.

His Art Will Live Forever!

Even though Kasali Akangbe Ogun is no longer with us, his beautiful wood carvings will stay forever! They are in people's homes, in museums, and maybe even in special places of worship. Each carving is a piece of him, a piece of his talent, and a piece of his culture. He taught many young people how to carve too, so his skills and knowledge will continue through them. It’s like he planted a seed, and now many new trees of art will grow from his teaching. His legacy, which means all the good things he left behind, is very big and very important. He showed us that taking care of our traditions and creating beauty with our hands is a very special gift. He truly was a master, and his memory will inspire many more artists in Africa and around the world. Did you know? A 'master' in art is someone who is so good at their craft that they can teach others and create truly exceptional work!

What Can We Learn?

So, what can we learn from Kasali Akangbe Ogun? We can learn to love and appreciate the beautiful art and traditions that come from our continent, Africa. We can learn that practicing something, like drawing or singing or even building with blocks, can make us very good at it, just like Kasali became a master carver. And we can learn that remembering our elders and their stories helps us stay connected to our past and makes our future brighter. Let’s keep our eyes open for beautiful art, wherever we go, and remember the wonderful Kasali Akangbe Ogun, the master wood carver from Nigeria! Bye for now, super stars!
summary: Kasali Akangbe Ogun, a super talented wood carver from Nigeria who came from a family of carvers and wanted to keep old traditions alive, has passed away and is being remembered for his amazing art.
whyMatters: This story is important because it teaches us about amazing African artists, how special it is when families pass down skills, and why it's super important to keep our old traditions and beautiful art safe so everyone can enjoy them for a long, long time!

originalTitle: More than 160 churchgoers kidnapped in twin Nigeria attacks - clergy
title: Friends Missing from Church in Nigeria – Everyone is Helping!
content:
Hello from Africa!

Hi everyone! I'm your friendly news reporter for Africa. Today, we're talking about something important happening far away. It's about some lovely people who went to church in a place called Nigeria. Africa is a very big continent. It has many, many countries. Nigeria is one of these countries. It is a wonderful place with lots of kind people. It has sunny weather and amazing animals. Did you know? Nigeria is in West Africa. It has a beautiful coastline along the Atlantic Ocean. Many different languages are spoken there, like Yoruba, Igbo, and Hausa!

What is a Church?

A church is a special building. It is a place where people go to pray and sing. They go to learn about God and feel close to their community. It's a bit like a big family gathering place. People often go to church on a special day. This day is usually Sunday. It is a time for everyone to come together. They share stories and feel happy with their friends and neighbours. Did you know? Churches come in many shapes and sizes. Some are very old and grand. Others are small and cozy. They are all places of peace and togetherness.

What Happened in Kurmin Wali?

In Nigeria, there is a place called Kurmin Wali. It is in a part of Nigeria called Kaduna State. On a recent Sunday, something sad happened there. People were in their churches. They were singing and praying, just like usual. They were having their Sunday service. It was a normal, happy Sunday morning. But then, some people came. They took some of the churchgoers away. These people are now not with their families. Everyone is very sad about this.

Who Are the Churchgoers?

The churchgoers are just like you and me. They are parents, children, grandmas, and grandpas. They are friends and neighbours. They love their community very much. They went to church to feel happy and safe. They wanted to spend time with their church family. Now, their families miss them a lot. Did you know? The word "churchgoer" just means someone who goes to church. It's a simple way to talk about the people who attend services regularly.

What are Grown-ups Doing to Help?

Lots of grown-ups are helping. The police are working very hard. They are looking for the missing people. They want to bring them back home safely. The police are brave people. They help keep everyone safe. They are searching everywhere. They are talking to people to find clues. Other important people are also helping. Community leaders are talking to everyone. They are making sure that families feel supported. Everyone is working together.

Why Do People Help So Much?

People help because they care. When someone in our community is sad, we all feel it. We want to make things better. That's what being a good neighbour means. It's like when your friend loses their favourite toy. You want to help them find it, right? Or give them a hug. This is much bigger, but the feeling is the same. We believe in kindness. We believe in helping each other. When we work together, we are stronger. This makes communities very special places.

Did You Know More About Nigeria?

Nigeria is sometimes called the "Giant of Africa"! This is because it has so many people. It's the most populated country in Africa! Nigeria has wonderful music and art. People love to dance and celebrate. They have amazing festivals with colourful clothes and tasty food. Did you know? The capital city of Nigeria is Abuja. It is a beautiful city with lots of tall buildings and parks.

Hoping for a Happy Return

Everyone is hoping and praying for the churchgoers to come home. Their families miss them so much. Their friends miss them too. We send them all our love and strength. We hope they are safe and strong wherever they are. We wish them a very speedy return to their homes. When sad things happen, it's important to remember hope. Hope means believing that good things will happen. It means we keep trying our best.

What Can We Do?

Even though we are far away, we can still help! We can think good thoughts for the people of Nigeria. We can send them our kindest wishes. We can also talk to our parents about what happened. We can learn more about helping others. Being kind and caring is always a good thing. Remember, even small acts of kindness make a big difference. Let's all be kind to each other, every single day.

A Message of Strength

The people of Kurmin Wali and Kaduna State are very strong. They are brave and they stick together. They are showing the world how much they care for each other. Their community is helping each other stay strong. They are comforting each other. This is what community is all about – being there for one another. We know that good will always win. We believe that the missing people will be found. And they will be reunited with their loving families.
summary: Some people who went to church in Nigeria are currently missing, and everyone is working hard to help bring them back home safely.
whyMatters: This is important because it shows how communities come together to help each other when sad things happen, and we should always care for our neighbours and hope for safety for everyone.

originalTitle: Drums, chants and celebrations as Ethiopians mark the baptism of Jesus
title: Splash, Dance, and Sing! It's Ethiopia's Big Water Party!
content:
Hello from Africa!

Hi everyone! It’s me, your friendly news reporter for Africa! Are you ready for some exciting news from a very special country? Today, we are going on an adventure to Ethiopia! Ethiopia is a beautiful country right here in Africa. It has tall mountains and friendly people. And guess what? They just had a super big party called Timket! It's a festival full of color, music, and lots of joy.

What is Timket, you ask?

Timket is a really important holiday for many people in Ethiopia. It's a special time when they remember something very important. They are celebrating the baptism of Jesus. "Baptism" means when someone goes into water, like a river, to show their faith. Jesus was baptized in a river called the Jordan a very, very long time ago. Did you know? Ethiopia is one of the oldest countries in Africa! It has a history that goes back thousands of years!

Getting Ready for the Big Day!

Getting ready for Timket is a very exciting time! People start preparing many days before. They clean their homes from top to bottom. Everyone wants their house to be super neat for the festival. It's like cleaning up for your birthday party! Families also cook lots of delicious food. They make special dishes that they only eat during Timket. Imagine yummy stews and fresh bread! Children get very excited because they know tasty treats are coming.

New Clothes and Happy Faces

On Timket, everyone wants to look their best! People buy or make beautiful new clothes. Many men and women wear special white robes. These robes are very simple but look so elegant and clean. Kids also get new outfits! They feel very special. Did you know? Wearing white clothes during Timket shows purity and new beginnings. It’s like a fresh start!

The Night Before: Ketera!

The real fun starts the day before Timket. This day is called Ketera. It’s a bit like Christmas Eve! On Ketera, something very special happens. Priests from all the churches bring out holy things called Tabots. These Tabots are like special boxes that represent the Ark of the Covenant. The Tabots are carried on the heads of the priests. They are wrapped in beautiful, colorful cloths. These cloths protect them. Each Tabot is taken from its church in a long, happy parade. The parade goes to a place near water, like a river or a special pool.

A Musical Walk

Imagine hundreds, even thousands, of people walking together! They are singing and chanting loudly. The sound of drums fills the air. People play special musical instruments called 'sistras' which make a jingling sound. It’s a wonderful noise, full of joy! Everyone dances and claps their hands. The whole town seems to be moving and singing. Children run alongside the parade, laughing and trying to keep up. It’s a truly amazing sight to see. Did you know? Drums are very important in African music and celebrations! They help people dance and tell stories.

The Holy Water

When the Tabots arrive at the water, they stay there for the night. Priests guard them. Early in the morning, on the main day of Timket, there are lots of prayers. The priests bless the water. They pray over it, making it holy. Then, the big moment comes! The priests sprinkle this holy water on everyone. It’s like a gentle shower of blessings. People believe this water reminds them of their own baptism and cleanses them. They feel very good and pure after the sprinkling.

A Big Splash!

Some people even jump into the water! It’s usually very cold, but they don’t mind. They are so happy to be part of the celebration. They jump in to renew their faith. It’s a very joyful and brave thing to do! Imagine jumping into cold water early in the morning! Did you know? Water is essential for all life on Earth! We need water to drink, grow food, and stay clean.

The Parade Back Home

After the prayers and the sprinkling, it’s time for another amazing parade! The Tabots are carried back to their churches. This parade is even bigger and louder than the first one. Everyone is full of happiness and energy. The colorful umbrellas are back! Priests carry big, beautiful, embroidered umbrellas over the Tabots. These umbrellas protect the holy items from the sun. They also add so much color to the celebration. Imagine bright red, yellow, and blue umbrellas everywhere!

Singing, Dancing, and Laughter

The streets are alive with music. People sing traditional songs and dance with all their hearts. Old people, young people, boys and girls – everyone joins in! The air is full of laughter and happy chatter. It’s a day to forget your worries and just be joyful. Children often try to imitate the dancers and drummers. They might have their own small drums or just clap along. It's a wonderful way for them to learn about their culture and traditions. It's like a giant street party for everyone! Did you know? Ethiopia has its own special calendar! It's a little different from the calendar most of the world uses.

Why is Timket Important?

Timket is important for many reasons. It reminds people of their faith and their connection to God. It brings families and communities closer together. Everyone celebrates as one big happy family. It is a time for sharing and caring. It's also a time to remember history. Ethiopians have celebrated Timket for hundreds of years. It shows how strong their traditions are. It’s a beautiful way to pass stories and beliefs from grandpas and grandmas to their grandkids. Did you know? Ethiopia is famous for its delicious coffee! Many people say coffee was first discovered there.

A Day of Unity and Joy

So, Timket is much more than just a festival. It’s a day of deep faith, colorful parades, wonderful music, and delicious food. It’s a day when the whole community comes together to celebrate something very special. It's a time for everyone to feel happy and united. And that’s the news from Ethiopia! Isn't it amazing how people celebrate important things with so much joy and color? Keep exploring and learning about our wonderful continent, Africa!
summary: Timket is a joyful Ethiopian festival that celebrates the baptism of Jesus with colorful parades, singing, dancing, and the blessing of water.
whyMatters: This festival is important because it strengthens people's faith, brings families and communities together, and showcases Ethiopia's rich cultural traditions in a very happy way.

originalTitle: Syria-SDF ceasefire hangs in balance after renewed clashes, faltering talks
title: Hoping for Peace in a Faraway Land: A Story from Syria
content:
Hello, Little Friends!

Hello, my wonderful friends across Africa! This is your special kid-friendly news reporter. I am here to share a story from a country far, far away. It is a country called Syria. It is a place with many people, just like our homes. Sometimes, big problems happen in faraway places, and we like to know about them. Today, we are talking about a big wish: the wish for peace. We always hope that everyone can live happily and safely, everywhere in the world.

What's Happening in Syria?

Syria is a country very far from where we live. Imagine a map, and you would see it on a different continent called Asia. For a long time, some groups of people in Syria have not been getting along. They have been having disagreements, and sometimes, these disagreements turn into fighting. Fighting makes everyone very sad. It can make people scared, and it means children cannot always go to school or play outside safely. So, people always try to find ways to stop the fighting.

What is a 'Ceasefire'?

Imagine you and your friend are playing. Maybe you start to argue about a toy. Then, a grown-up might say, "Okay, time out! Stop arguing for a little while." A "ceasefire" is just like that! It means that people agree to stop fighting for a time. It is a very good thing because when there is a ceasefire, no one gets hurt. People can rest, and maybe they can talk about how to solve their problems without fighting. Did you know? The word 'cease' means to stop. So, a 'ceasefire' means to stop the fire of fighting! It’s like pressing the pause button on a game.

Who Are the Groups?

In Syria, there are two main groups we are talking about today. One group is like the grown-ups who are in charge of the country. They are called "Syria's government." They make rules for the country. The other group is like local protectors. They are called "Kurdish-led forces." Think of them as people who protect their homes and families in certain parts of Syria. These two groups have had different ideas about how things should be. For a while, they tried to have a ceasefire. They promised to stop fighting. This made many people very happy and hopeful for peace.

When Fights Start Again

Sadly, something not so good happened. After they agreed to stop fighting, some small fights started again. This is what we call "renewed clashes." It means that the fighting, which had stopped, started up again in some places. It's like when you agree to stop arguing with your friend, but then a little bit later, you start to disagree again. It's sad when a ceasefire doesn't last for long. It means people are still hurting. Did you know? Clashes are usually small fights, not big, long wars. But even small fights can make people feel unsafe and unhappy.

The Blame Game

When these new fights started, both groups did something that makes it harder to fix things. They started to blame each other! The government group said, "It's your fault the fighting started again!" And the Kurdish-led forces said, "No, it's *your* fault!" This is called "trading blame." It means both sides are pointing fingers instead of trying to understand what went wrong together. When people blame each other, it's very hard to find a solution and become friends again. Did you know? In many African cultures, talking things out with respect is very important to solve problems, rather than blaming.

Who are the Bad Guys? (ISIL)

There's another big problem in Syria. There is a very, very bad group of people. They are called ISIL. These people like to hurt others and cause a lot of trouble. They are truly bad guys, and they make life very difficult for everyone. Sometimes, these bad guys are captured and kept away from doing harm. But when fighting starts again, sometimes these bad guys can escape. This is a very scary thing for everyone in Syria. Both groups are also blaming each other about these escaped bad guys. It's like if a naughty bully escaped from being kept away, and then two teachers blamed each other instead of working together to get the bully back. It makes the situation even harder.

Talking, But Not Solving

The two groups, the government and the Kurdish-led forces, tried to talk to each other to solve their problems. These talks are called "negotiations." Imagine a grown-up meeting where people sit down and try to agree on things. They hoped to find a way to make the ceasefire last forever and to stop all the fighting. They wanted to make rules so everyone could live in peace. But sadly, these talks did not go well. They "reached a dead end." This means they could not agree on important things. It's like if you and your friend talked and talked about how to share a toy, but just couldn't find a way to make it fair for both of you. So, the problem is still there. Did you know? The United Nations is a very big group of countries that tries to help people talk and make peace all over the world, even in places like Syria.

Why Is Peace Important?

Fighting is never good. It makes everyone sad, scared, and hurt. It stops children from learning and playing. Peace, however, is a wonderful thing! When there is peace, children can go to school, play outside, and families can live without fear. We want the children of Syria to have peace. We want them to have safe homes and happy days, just like you do. Every child deserves to live in a peaceful place. Did you know? When there is peace, birds sing, flowers bloom, and people smile more. It's a beautiful thing!

What Can We Do?

Even though Syria is far away, we can still hope for peace. We can learn from this story that talking is always better than fighting. When we have disagreements with our friends, we should try to talk, listen, and find a solution together. Let's be kind to each other, our families, and our friends. Let's remember that working together and being understanding is the best way to solve problems, not blaming or fighting.

Let's Hope for Peace!

So, my friends, let's keep hoping for peace in Syria. Let's hope that the people there can find a way to talk and stop the fighting for good. Every child, everywhere, deserves peace. Thank you for listening to this important news story. Be kind and spread peace where you are!
summary: In a faraway country called Syria, two groups, the government and local protectors, tried to stop fighting, but small clashes started again, and they are blaming each other while talks to find peace are not working.
whyMatters: This story matters because fighting makes people sad and unsafe, especially children, and we hope that talking and finding peace can make everyone happy and safe in Syria, just like we want for everyone in Africa and the world.

originalTitle: Guatemala mourns 10 police slain by gangsters amid state of emergency
title: Brave Police and Special Rules in Faraway Guatemala
content:
Hello, amazing friends! It’s your kid-friendly news reporter from Africa here, bringing you important stories from around our big, beautiful world. Today, we’re going to talk about a country far, far away from us. It’s called Guatemala.

Where is Guatemala?

Guatemala is a land filled with wonders, much like our own home in Africa! It is in a place called Central America. This means it's between North America and South America, quite a long way from our continent. It has beautiful green mountains, deep jungles, and ancient buildings that are super old, built by people who lived there long, long ago. But sometimes, even in the most beautiful places, sad things can happen. It’s important to learn about them so we can understand our world better and wish for peace everywhere.

Sad News from Guatemala

There's some very sad news from Guatemala right now. Ten brave police officers have been hurt very badly while doing their job. They have sadly passed away. These police officers are heroes. They work super hard every single day to keep everyone safe, just like the police officers do in our towns and cities here in Africa. When we hear about brave helpers getting hurt, it makes everyone feel very, very sad. The whole country of Guatemala is feeling this sadness, and we call that "mourning." Mourning means people are remembering the brave officers and feeling very, very sad for them and their families. It’s a way to show we care deeply.

Who Are the "Bad Guys"?

You might be wondering, "Who would do such a terrible thing?" It was some bad people called "gangsters." Gangsters are groups of people who do wrong things together. They don't follow rules, and they can make places feel unsafe for others. They cause trouble and sometimes hurt people, which is very, very wrong. Police officers try their best to stop them and keep everyone out of harm's way.

What is a "State of Emergency"?

Because of this very serious problem and the harm caused by gangsters, the leaders in Guatemala have made a special rule. It’s called a "State of Emergency." That sounds like a big, grown-up word, doesn't it? Let's make it simple! Imagine your home or your school. If there's a big problem, like a fire or something really tricky and dangerous happening, your grown-ups or teachers might have special rules for a little while. Maybe everyone needs to stay very quiet, or move to a safe spot quickly, or perhaps even stay home from school for a day. These special rules help everyone stay safe, very fast. A "State of Emergency" is just like that, but for a whole country. It's a special, temporary rule for when things are very, very dangerous and need extra fast help. It helps the police and other helpers work extra quickly and bravely to make things safe again for everyone.

How Does the Special Rule Help Police?

One important part of this special "State of Emergency" rule is how the police can catch bad people. Usually, if the police think someone has done something wrong, they need a special paper before they can take that person to the police station. This special paper is like a permission slip from a judge, saying it’s okay to investigate further. It's called a "judicial order." But during a "State of Emergency," when things are very serious and time is important, the police can move much faster. They can "arrest" people they think might be gangsters or doing bad things, even *without* that special paper right away. "Arrest" means the police take someone to the police station to ask them questions and find out what happened. It’s a way to investigate quickly. This helps them catch the bad guys quickly and stop more trouble from happening right away. It's like when your teacher steps in immediately to stop a fight, without needing to ask for extra permission first. It is a special way to keep everyone safer, faster, when the whole country is facing a very serious problem.

Did You Know? Fun Facts!

**Did you know?** The national bird of Guatemala is called the Resplendent Quetzal! It has amazing colourful feathers, usually green, red, and white. It’s a very special bird! **Did you know?** Police officers wear uniforms so you can easily spot them when you need help. Their uniforms often have special shiny badges to show they are police. **Did you know?** In many African countries, police also work hard every single day to keep communities safe. They help with finding lost children, guiding traffic, and catching people who do wrong things. **Did you know?** Guatemala is famous for its delicious coffee beans and colourful clothes called textiles! People all over the world enjoy coffee from Guatemala. **Did you know?** When a country "mourns," people might wear special colours like black, have quiet moments of silence, or light candles to remember those who are gone and show their respect.

Why We Care About Guatemala

You might be thinking, "Why are we learning about a place so far away?" Well, even though Guatemala is far from Africa, we care about what happens there. Because everywhere in the world, people want to live in peace. We all want to be safe, play with our friends, go to school, and live without worry. Brave police officers, whether in Guatemala or in our own communities, help make that happen for us. When we hear about heroes getting hurt, it makes us sad for them and their families. It reminds us that peace is precious.

Hoping for Peace

The people in Guatemala are hoping for peace and safety to come back very soon. They want the gangsters to stop their bad ways and for everyone to be safe again. The special "State of Emergency" rule is there to help the police work harder and faster to make that happen. It helps them protect everyone and bring justice for the brave officers who were hurt while protecting their community. So, remember our brave police helpers in Guatemala and everywhere else. And remember that even when sad things happen, people work together to make things right and safe again. Let's always hope for peace and safety for everyone, everywhere in our amazing world. Stay safe and keep learning, my wonderful friends! See you next time for more news!
summary: Police in a country called Guatemala are very sad because some bad people hurt brave police officers, so they have a special rule to help them catch the bad guys faster.
whyMatters: It's important to learn about brave helpers and special rules that keep people safe, even in places far away from us, because everyone deserves to live in peace and live without fear.

originalTitle: Iran ‘just getting started’ on punishing ‘rioters’ arrested during protests
title: Helping to Fix Things Far Away
content:
Hello, my wonderful friends all across Africa! It’s your friendly news reporter here, ready to share some important news from a land far, far away. We learn about so many amazing things every day, and today, we have a story about a country that is working hard to make things right again.

Big Gatherings and Broken Things

Imagine a time when many people gathered together in one place. Sometimes, when lots and lots of people are together, things can get a little messy. In a country very far away from us, there were times when many people were very, very upset about different things. During these times, sadly, some things got broken. It's like when you might accidentally drop a toy and it breaks, or if someone isn't careful and spills paint everywhere. But these were bigger things, like maybe windows in buildings or parts of streets. It's always sad when things get broken, isn't it? When a toy breaks, we feel a little sad. When bigger things in a town break, it can make many people feel sad and worried.

Grown-ups in Charge Want to Help

The grown-ups who look after that faraway country are like the helpers of a big family. They want to make sure everyone is safe and happy in their homes and towns. They want to fix all the broken things so that everyone can live comfortably again. When something breaks, we need to mend it, right? Just like when your favorite cup breaks, you try to glue it back together carefully. Or when your clothes get a little tear, your mum or dad might sew them up for you. Fixing broken things takes a lot of effort. And it also costs money. Think about how much it costs to buy new windows for a big building, or to paint a whole wall again. It can be a lot of money and work!

Did You Know?

Did you know that in many places all around the world, when something gets broken, people work together to fix it? It’s called teamwork! Just like when you and your friends clean up your classroom after play time, everyone helps to make things nice again.

How They Are Fixing Things

So, the grown-ups in charge in that faraway country had an idea about how to help fix everything. They are asking for help to pay for all the repairs that are needed. They are looking at the people who were part of the big gatherings where things got broken. They are collecting special things from some people. These things are like money or other valuable items that can be sold. When these things are sold, the money from them will be used. This money will then be used to pay for fixing all the broken windows, painting the walls, mending the roads, and repairing other important things in the towns. It's a way to get the money needed to make everything good as new. It’s a bit like if you accidentally broke a school window during a game while playing. The school might ask your parents to help pay to fix it. It’s about making things fair and making sure everything gets fixed so everyone can use it again.

Why This Is Important

Making things right again is very, very important for everyone. When things are broken, they are not safe. Imagine a broken fence around a park – children might not be safe playing there, or animals might get out. Or think about a broken road. It can make it very hard for cars, buses, and bikes to move around safely. People might not be able to go to school or work easily. Broken things can also make a town look messy and sad. Did You Know?

Did you know that when we fix things that are broken, we are also making our communities stronger? When people work together to repair and rebuild, everyone feels happier and safer. It’s like when we help clean up our neighborhood, it makes it a nicer place for everyone to live and play!

Learning About Rules

Every country, just like every home and every school, has rules. Rules help us live together happily and safely. Think about the rules in your home – like don’t run inside, or share your toys. These rules help everyone get along and stay safe. When rules are broken, sometimes things can get messy, or even broken. This story from far away reminds us that grown-ups try very hard to make sure rules are followed. And if something does get broken, they try to find a way to make it whole and good again. It’s also about taking responsibility. When we make a mistake, or something gets broken because of us, it’s good and kind to help fix it. This is a big lesson that grown-ups learn too, not just children.

Helping Our Neighbours

Even though this country is very far away from us in Africa, we can still learn from their story. It teaches us about the importance of looking after our homes, our schools, and our communities. It teaches us about helping each other when things go wrong or get broken. Imagine if your friend accidentally knocked over your tower of blocks while you were playing. A kind friend would help you pick them up and build them again, right? It's the same idea, but on a much bigger scale for a whole country.

Did You Know?

Did you know that Africa is a very big continent with many, many countries, just like a very big family with many homes? And in all those countries, people work hard every day to keep their homes and communities safe and tidy. We all try to be good neighbours and help each other!

The Future is Bright

So, the grown-ups in that faraway country are working very hard to clean up and fix all the broken things. They are trying to make sure that everyone can live peacefully and safely, and that their towns look nice again. It’s a big job, but with everyone’s help, they can do it. We hope that soon, all the broken things will be mended, and everyone in that country can enjoy their beautiful land without worry. It's a good reminder for all of us, no matter where we live, to be kind, careful, and to help fix things when they break. Thank you for listening, my friends! See you next time for more news from around our amazing world!
summary: In a country far away, some things got broken during big gatherings, and now the grown-ups in charge are collecting money and things from some people to help fix everything and make the country safe again.
whyMatters: This matters because when things break, it's important to fix them so everyone can be safe and happy, and it reminds us all about taking care of our communities and helping each other.

originalTitle: Trump says he will '100%' carry out Greenland tariffs threat, as EU vows to protect its interests
title: A Cool Island, Big Leaders, and Money Talk!
content:
Hello, Super Friends!

Hello, hello, my super friends from all over Africa! It's your friendly news reporter here, ready to share some big news from far, far away. Today, we have a very interesting story. It's about a leader from America, a big island made of ice, and a team of countries in Europe. It's a story about talking, money, and being fair! Sometimes, leaders of different countries have big talks. They talk about what is fair and what is best for their people. Our story today is about one of these big talks that happened not long ago. It teaches us how countries work together, even when they don't always agree right away.

Meet Greenland: The Icy Island!

Our story starts with a very special place called Greenland. Have you heard of it? Imagine a huge, huge island, bigger than many countries put together! Most of Greenland is covered in ice and snow. Brrr, it sounds very, very cold there! Not many people live on Greenland because it's so icy. But it is a very beautiful place. It has big glaciers and amazing views. Greenland is part of a country called Denmark. Denmark is a country in Europe. **Did you know?** Greenland is the biggest island in the entire world! It's so massive, it looks like a giant white blanket on the map! It's not a continent, but it's bigger than many countries.

What Did Mr. Trump Want?

Now, let's meet one of the people in our story: Mr. Trump. He was the leader, or president, of America a little while ago. America is a very big country far away from Africa and Europe. Mr. Trump had an idea that surprised many people. He thought it would be a good idea for America to buy Greenland! Yes, to buy an entire island, just like you might buy a toy from a shop! He thought Greenland was very special. Maybe because it's so big, or because it has important minerals and resources hidden under all that ice. But Greenland belongs to Denmark, remember? The leaders of Denmark and the people of Greenland said, "No, thank you! Greenland is not for sale." They were happy being part of Denmark. This made Mr. Trump a bit unhappy.

What Are "Tariffs"? (It's About Money!)

When Mr. Trump heard "no," he said something that sounded a bit like a warning. He said America might put "tariffs" on things that come from Europe. What are tariffs? Imagine you want to buy a yummy cookie. If that cookie comes from another country, a "tariff" is like an extra coin you have to pay for it. It makes things from other countries a bit more expensive. Countries sometimes use tariffs for different reasons. Maybe they want people to buy more things made in their *own* country. Or, sometimes, they use tariffs when they are not happy with another country. So, Mr. Trump was saying, "If Denmark won't let us buy Greenland, maybe we will make things from Europe more expensive for Americans to buy." This was his "tariffs threat." **Did you know?** When a country puts a tariff on something, it's usually because they want to help their own businesses or make a point to another country. It's like adding a special tax!

Who is the EU? (A Team of Friends!)

Now, let's meet the other important group in our story: the EU. The EU stands for the "European Union." It's like a very big team of many, many countries in Europe that work together. Imagine you and your friends playing a game. You all work together to help each other, right? That's what the countries in the EU try to do. They work together on many things, like making rules for buying and selling, and helping each other stay safe. Some countries in the EU are France, Germany, Italy, and many more! Denmark, the country that owns Greenland, is also part of this big team. So, when Mr. Trump talked about tariffs on things from Europe, it worried the EU. **Did you know?** The EU has over 27 countries working together! They all have their own languages and cultures, but they try to be good neighbors and help each other out.

What Did the EU Say Back?

When the EU heard Mr. Trump's words about tariffs, they had to think about their friends and their businesses. A kind lady named Kaja Kallas, who helps the EU with big talks, spoke up. She said that the EU does "not want to pick a fight." This means they don't want to cause trouble or argue. They want everyone to get along and follow fair rules. But she also said, "We will hold our ground." This means they will stand strong and protect their countries and their people. They won't let anyone hurt their businesses or make things unfair for them. So, the EU was saying, "We want to be friends, but we will make sure our own team is safe and treated fairly." They didn't want extra coins put on their yummy cookies and other things without a very good reason.

Why is This Story Important?

This story might seem like it's from far away, but it's important to us too! It shows us how leaders and countries talk to each other all the time. Sometimes, they don't agree on everything. But even when they don't agree, they try to find ways to solve problems. They talk and discuss. They try to find solutions that are fair for everyone. It's like when you and your friends have a small disagreement, you talk about it to make things right. This story reminds us that every country tries to do what is best for its own people. And that working together, even when it's tricky, is very important for a peaceful world. It's all about fairness, friends, and understanding each other. **Did you know?** Talking and listening are super important skills, not just for kids but for big leaders too! It helps everyone understand each other better and find good solutions. So, that's our story from far away today! A big icy island, a leader with an idea, and a team of countries protecting their friends. Keep listening to the news to learn more about our amazing world!

originalTitle: Spain to hold three days of mourning for victims of high-speed train crash
title: A Sad Train Story Far Away in Spain
content:
Hello, Little Explorers!

Hello, my wonderful friends! Your kid-friendly reporter from Africa is here to share some news with you. Sometimes news can be happy, and sometimes it can be a little sad. Today, we have some news from a country very far away called Spain. It's important to talk about all kinds of news, so we can learn and understand our big world better. We are going to talk about a sad accident that happened there. But don't worry, we will talk about it gently. We will also talk about how people help each other when sad things happen. It reminds us that even when bad things happen, there are always kind people ready to help.

A Sad Day Far Away in Spain

Imagine a big, fast train, like a super-long bus that runs on special tracks. This train was traveling in a country called Spain. Spain is a beautiful place with sunny beaches and old castles. But last Sunday, something very sad happened there. A very fast train had an accident. This accident was very big and made many people very sad. When the train crashed, it hurt many people. Sadly, some people lost their lives. This means they are not with us anymore. More than 40 people died in this sad accident. This made everyone in Spain, and many people around the world, feel very, very sad. It was one of the biggest train accidents Spain has seen in more than ten years. That's a very long time!

What Happened to the Train?

The train was going very, very fast. It was an express train, which means it travels quickly to get people where they need to go faster. It was going around a corner, and it was going too fast for that part of the track. Because it was going so fast, the train came off its tracks. This is called a derailment. When a train derails, it means it doesn't stay on its special path anymore. It can be very dangerous. Many of the train's carriages, which are like the big rooms where people sit, fell over. Some even crashed into each other. It was a very big mess, and it was very scary for the people on the train. Did you know? The fastest train in the world can go as fast as a racing car! But trains must always be careful, especially around corners.

Where is Spain?

Spain is a country in Europe. It's not in Africa, but it's not super far either! If you look at a map, it's across the sea from some parts of Africa. Spain is famous for its delicious food, its beautiful dances, and its exciting football games. People in Spain speak a language called Spanish. Did you know? The capital city of Spain is Madrid. It's a very big city with lots of interesting buildings and parks!

Being Sad Together: What is Mourning?

When something very sad happens, like this train accident, people feel a lot of sadness. Sometimes, when many people are sad about the same thing, they come together to show their sadness and to remember the people who are gone. This is called 'mourning'. In Spain, the leaders of the country decided to have three days of mourning. This means for three whole days, people in Spain will remember the people who died. They will think about their families and friends. It's a way to show care and respect. During these days, flags might fly at half-mast, which means they are lowered a little bit to show sadness. People might wear black clothes or gather quietly to pray or simply be together. It helps people feel not so alone in their sadness. It shows that everyone cares and everyone is thinking about those who are hurting. It's like when someone in your class is sad, and all your friends give them a hug or say kind words. It makes a big difference. Did you know? People all over the world have different ways to show they are sad and remember people. But the feeling of care and love is always the same.

Heroes Who Help

Even in sad times, there are always heroes. When the train crashed, many brave people rushed to help. These were people like doctors and nurses who help fix injuries. There were also firefighters who helped get people out of the train. Police officers helped keep everyone safe and calm. Rescue workers worked very hard, day and night, to find people and help them. They are like real-life superheroes! They put on special gear and used special tools to reach people who were trapped. They were very careful and very kind. They saved many lives and helped many injured people feel better. Other kind people helped too. They brought food and water to the helpers. They gave hugs to families who were worried. These good people remind us that even when bad things happen, there is always goodness and kindness in the world. Did you know? Many rescue workers train for years to be ready for emergencies like this. They are truly amazing!

Learning from Sad Moments

After a big accident like this, people always try to find out exactly what happened. They look at the train, the tracks, and talk to people who were there. This is very important. Why? Because they want to learn from it. They want to make sure that trains are even safer in the future. They want to stop such sad things from happening again. Every time we learn from an accident, we can make things better and safer for everyone. This is how we grow and make our world a better place. Did you know? Modern trains have many safety features, like special brakes and warning systems, to help prevent accidents.

A Message from Your Friend

This was a very sad story, my dear friends. But it also shows us how strong people are, how kind people can be, and how important it is to help each other. When you hear about sad news, remember that it's okay to feel sad. It's also important to think about the helpers and the kind hearts in the world. Let's always be kind to each other and remember to be careful and safe in everything we do. Thank you for listening, and I'll be back soon with more news from our amazing world!
summary: A very fast train in Spain had a sad accident, causing many people to get hurt or lose their lives, and the country is now taking three days to be sad together and remember everyone affected.
whyMatters: This sad story teaches us that accidents can happen, but also how people come together to help each other, show kindness, and learn how to make things safer for everyone in the future.

originalTitle: Saved by 'special talent' - but did penalty award wrong Brighton?
title: A Super Goal and a Tricky Decision in Football!
content:
Hello, Little Champions!

Hello, my amazing friends! Do you love to play games? Do you love to run and kick a ball? Well, today we have a super fun story about a football game! Football is a game where two teams try to kick a ball into the other team's goal. It's so exciting to watch and to play!

Meet the Brighton Seagulls!

Imagine a team of birds called "Seagulls." Not real birds that fly, but a football team! This team is called Brighton. They wear special colourful clothes, called a kit, and they play together as a team to try and win games. They run very fast on the big field and kick the ball with their feet. Did you know? In Africa, many children love to play football! They play with their friends in parks, on dusty roads, and in open fields. Sometimes they even make their own footballs from old plastic bags or cloths! They are very clever!

What is a Football Game?

A football game has two teams playing against each other. Each team usually has eleven players on the field at one time. They play on a big green grass field called a pitch. At each end of the pitch, there is a big net called a goal. The main idea is to kick the ball into the other team's goal. When you do this, you score a point for your team! More goals mean more points, and the team with the most points wins!

Charalampos's Special Kick!

Now, let me tell you about a very special player. His name is Charalampos Kostoulas! Can you say that? Charalampos! He is a very good player and he plays for the Brighton team. In one game, Charalampos did something absolutely amazing and super clever! He kicked the ball in a very, very special way. He kicked it high over his head while he was falling backward! Imagine trying to kick a ball like that! This amazing trick kick is called an "overhead kick." It's like doing a somersault with the ball! It needs a lot of strength and practice to do it just right. Did you know? An overhead kick is one of the hardest and most beautiful kicks to do in football! It needs a lot of skill and balance. Imagine kicking a ball when you are in the air and your back is facing the goal! Wow, what a talent!

A Goal That Gets a Point!

When Charalampos made his amazing overhead kick, the ball flew through the air and went straight into the other team's goal! Everyone who was watching cheered very, very loudly! A goal is super important in football because it means your team gets closer to winning. Each goal gives the team one point. This means Brighton got one point because of Charalampos's amazing kick. Sometimes, getting a point can change the whole game! It can make your team tie with the other team, instead of losing the game. It makes everyone feel excited and happy!

Oh No, a Penalty!

But something else happened earlier in the game that made the Brighton team a little bit sad and confused. Before Charalampos scored his big goal, the referee made a decision. Do you know who a referee is? A referee is like a special judge or a teacher in the game. They make sure everyone plays by the rules and that the game is fair for both teams. They wear a special shirt so everyone can see them clearly. Did you know? The referee wears a different colored shirt so everyone can see them clearly on the field! They use a whistle to stop and start the game, and sometimes they show yellow or red cards to players if they do something very wrong. The referee gave a "penalty" to the other team. A penalty is a special free kick that happens when one player does something wrong inside a special box near their own goal. If a penalty is given, a player from the other team gets to kick the ball from very close to the goal, with only the goalkeeper to stop it. It's usually very easy to score a goal from a penalty kick because it's so close to the net.

Was it Fair?

The Brighton team felt that the referee's decision to give a penalty was not fair. They thought their player did not do anything wrong to get a penalty. Sometimes, even in games, decisions can be tricky. One team might think something is fair, and the other team might not agree. But the referee makes the final decision, and all the players must listen to the referee. Even if you are sad or don't agree with a decision, you must keep playing your best. It's important to respect the referee's decision and keep your focus on the game. That's what good sportsmanship is all about! Did you know? Sometimes, new technology like special cameras and video replays helps referees make better decisions in big football games! This helps make the game even fairer.

Playing Fair and Having Fun!

Even with the tricky penalty decision, Brighton kept playing their very best. And Charalampos showed everyone his amazing skill with his fantastic overhead kick! This reminds us that even when things are difficult or seem unfair, it's important to keep trying your best and never give up. And to always try and play fair with everyone. Football is about teamwork, showing off your skills, and having lots and lots of fun together with your friends and teammates! Keep practicing your kicks and remember to always play with a smile, little champions!

What We Learned!

So, what did we learn today? We learned about the Brighton Seagulls football team. We learned about Charalampos Kostoulas and his super-duper, amazing overhead kick that got his team a point! We also learned about goals, points, and even tricky penalty decisions that can happen in a game. But most importantly, we learned that playing football is about working together, trying your hardest, and having a good time, no matter what! What an exciting game!

originalTitle: Who has made Troy's Premier League team of the week?
title: Picking Our Awesome Football Team!
content:
Hello, my amazing friends from all over Africa! Are you ready for some exciting news about football? Football is a game we all love. It makes us jump and cheer! Today, we are talking about picking a special team. Imagine choosing the best players you saw this week!

What is Football?

Football is a super fun game! Two teams play against each other. Each team tries to kick a big round ball into the other team's net. You mostly use your feet to play. It's played on a big green field. We call it a pitch! Everyone runs very fast. They pass the ball to their friends. The team that scores more goals wins! It's very exciting to watch. Did you know? Football is the most popular game in the whole wide world! So many people play it and watch it.

What is the Premier League?

Now, let's talk about the Premier League. It is a very, very big football competition. It happens in a country called England. Many strong teams play in the Premier League. They play games almost every week! All the teams want to win. They try their best to be the champion team at the end. It is a league where only the best players get to play. Did you know? There are 20 teams that play in the Premier League every year! That's a lot of teams!

Meet Troy Deeney!

Our story today is about a kind man named Troy Deeney. He used to be a fantastic football player himself! He played in the Premier League for many years. He scored many goals and helped his team. Now, Troy watches all the games very, very carefully. He loves football just like you and me! Did you know? Troy Deeney played for a team called Watford for a very long time! He was a captain, which means he was a leader for his team.

What is a "Team of the Week"?

Every week, after all the big Premier League games are finished, Troy Deeney does something fun. He picks his own special "Team of the Week"! What does that mean? It means he chooses 11 players. These are the players he thinks played the very best that week. He picks them from all the different teams that played. Imagine if you could pick all your favourite players from different schools to make one super team. That's what Troy does, but with famous football players! It's like building a dream team.

How Does Troy Pick His Team?

Troy has to think very hard when he picks his team. He looks at all the players. * **Goalkeeper**: He picks one goalkeeper. This player is super brave. They stop the ball from going into their own net. They dive and jump! * **Defenders**: He picks players who are good at stopping the other team from scoring. They protect their goal very well. They are strong and fast. * **Midfielders**: These players run a lot! They are in the middle of the field. They help pass the ball to the attackers. They also help the defenders. * **Attackers**: These are the players who score goals! They are very good at kicking the ball into the net. They are usually very fast and clever. Troy looks for players who were super brave, super fast, or super smart. He picks players who helped their team win. Or players who played really, really well, even if their team did not win. It's not easy to choose, because so many players are good! Did you know? A football team always has 11 players on the field when the game starts! This includes one goalkeeper and ten other players.

Why Do We Like to Pick a Team?

It's so much fun to pick a team! It's like a special puzzle. You get to think about who was the best. Maybe you saw a player score an amazing goal. Maybe you saw a player save a super hard shot. Everyone has their favourite players. You can talk with your friends about who *you* would pick! Do you agree with Troy Deeney's choices? Or would you pick different players for your own special team? It's fun to talk about football with your friends and family. Did you know? Many children in Africa dream of becoming famous footballers one day! Some of the best players in the world come from Africa.

Let's Imagine Our Own Super Team!

Now, close your eyes for a moment. Imagine you watched all the games. Who would be in YOUR team of the week? Would it be the fastest runner? The best goal scorer? Or maybe the player who always passes the ball to their friends? What about the player who makes everyone smile? Think about the amazing players we have right here in Africa! There are so many talented boys and girls who love to play football. Maybe one day, someone will pick *you* for a "team of the week"! Keep practicing and having fun.

Keep Cheering for Football!

Football is a wonderful game that brings people together. It teaches us about teamwork and being strong. Keep watching the games, keep cheering for your favourite teams, and keep playing with your friends! Who knows, maybe one day you will be a famous footballer, and someone like Troy Deeney will pick you for their "Team of the Week"! That would be amazing!
summary: Troy Deeney, a former football player, watches Premier League games and every week he picks his special "Team of the Week" with the best 11 players from all the matches, and it's fun to imagine who you would pick too!
whyMatters: This is important because it helps us learn about football, understand how players are chosen for their good play, and it's a fun way to talk about our favorite players and the game.
